meanings.sent1: We decided to copublish our research findings with another team.
meanings.sent2: The two companies agreed to copublish the new book together.
meanings.sent3: The idea to copublish the cookbook with a famous chef was a recipe for success.
meanings.sent4: Their decision to copublish the magazine was a collaborative masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The authors chose to copublish their novels to reach a wider audience.

meanings.definition: To publish a work simultaneously with another publisher.
meanings.sent1: The author wanted to copublish the novel with two different publishers.
meanings.sent2: They planned to copublish the magazine in both print and digital formats.
meanings.sent3: The decision to copublish the comic book on the same day was a graphic success.
meanings.sent4: Copublishing the research paper with two journals was a strategic move.
meanings.sent5: The musicians agreed to copublish their album to maximize exposure.
